data.title: The 26 best photo spots in Visakhapatnam

placeMetadata.name: Yarada Beach

sources.snippet: Yarada beach is a quieter spot for photography when compared to RK beach. The hills on three sides surround this beach giving it an isolated location with picturesque views The untouched sandy beaches and clear waters make it an ideal place for shooting nature and seascape photographs The surrounding hills are great vantage points from where you can take the photographs in different angles Sunrise or sunset especially at Yarada Beach during golden hour gives a magical experience for both sunrise and sunset with soft lighting to enhance the natural beauty of the area.
sources.shortName: 10 Must-Visit Places For Photography Enthusiasts In Vizag City

sources.snippet: Vizag is dotted with many beaches along its coastline, with the most famous one being the Yarada Beach. One of the most stunning places to see in all of Visakhapatnam, Yarada beach is surrounded by majestic hills on three sides, and by the Bay of Bengal on the other side. One of the best things about Vizag‚Äôs beaches is that they are a lot cleaner and a lot less crowded than other famous beaches along the Indian coastline, and Yarada beach is no exception.
sources.shortName: Tourism | Visakhapatnam District, Government of Andhra Pradesh

sources.snippet: Located near Gangavaram Port, Yarada Beach is crowded and best suited for a pre-wedding photoshoot at Vizag. The fine sand and rocky cliffs give the best panoramic shots, the entire area is covered with hundreds of banana and coconut plantations making it an absolutely beautiful location for a pre-wedding shoot. It has no entry fees, the best time to visit is during the day and it is usually crowded on Wednesday, Saturday and Sunday.
sources.shortName: Top 15 places to have a pre-wedding photo shoot at Vizag

sources.snippet: Yarada Beach, near Gangavaram Port, is busy and ideal for a pre-wedding photoshoot in Vizag. The fine sand and rugged cliffs provide the ideal panoramic photos, and the area is surrounded by hundreds of banana and coconut plantations, making it an extremely stunning location for pre-wedding photography. There are no admission prices, and the ideal time to come is during the day.
sources.shortName: Top Shooting Locations in Visakhapatnam To Visit

sources.snippet: Another popular attraction in Vizag, Yarada beach is one of the well maintained beaches of the city. The golden sand and pristine waters at the beach makes it one of best places in Vizag to spend some memorable moments with your loved ones. The picturesque beauty of the surroundings and breathtaking views of sunrise and sunset will leave you awestruck.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Vizag (Visakhapatnam)

sources.snippet: About 15 kilometres from the city of Visakhapatnam lies the Yarada Village, the coast of which formulates the stunning Yarada Beach. The Bay of Bengal borders the beach and gives it a serene outlook. On the other three sides, towering hills border the beach, making it a calm and peaceful sanctuary for tourists and locals alike.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam & Top Tourist Places

sources.snippet: Yarada Beach is a hidden gem that is well-known for its peaceful surroundings and fine sands. This beach, which is surrounded by hills, is ideal for couples looking for a more private location for their wedding picture shoot. The breathtaking vistas of the ocean and the verdant surroundings provide the ideal setting.

sources.snippet: This beach offers a fabulous landscape with its exotic blend of golden sands and the lush green stretch of hills. Nestled between the hills on all the three sides and the Bay of Bengal on one side, this beach is an ideal spot for outing. Unlike RK Beach, this beach is not commercialized much.

sources.snippet: Yarada Beach: Yarada Beach is one of the most popular beaches in Vizag. Located near Gangavaram Port, it boasts fine sand and rocky cliffs, providing a perfect panoramic shot. placeMetadata.description: Celebrated beach area featuring scenic cliffs with ocean views & a peaceful atmosphere.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Yarada Beach is a serene and picturesque destination in Visakhapatnam, also known as Vizag. Surrounded by scenic cliffs and offering stunning ocean views, this beach provides a peaceful atmosphere for travelers seeking an escape from city life. The untouched sandy shores and clear waters make it an ideal spot for nature and seascape photography. With hills on three sides, the beach boasts isolated surroundings that are perfect for capturing breathtaking shots.
placeMetadata.address: Andhra Pradesh, India

reviews.reviewText:
Visited Yarada Beach with my friend Ayush during our Vizag trip, and it was an unforgettable experience! The drive to the beach was a bit risky ‚Äî winding roads and sharp turns made it quite the adventure ‚Äî but totally worth it for the breathtaking view that awaited us.
We spent a relaxing two hours there, soaking in the natural beauty and sipping on some of the biggest and freshest coconuts we‚Äôve ever had! ü••‚òÄÔ∏è The beach is clean, peaceful, and offers a perfect escape from the city buzz.
Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind with a scenic backdrop! Just be cautious on those roads. üòâ

Yarada is a beautiful long beach, with coconut grooves and dense hills on one side.
Good for long walks, quality time with family and kids or picnic.
Actual beach front is steep, not recommend for bathing due to safety reasons.
Not much of commercialization, no shacks, no restaurants.
It's painful to see such a beautiful beach surrounding littered with polythenes and bottles.

The drive to reach this beach is fairly decent, with accessible roads and manageable traffic. However, the beach itself is quite disappointing. Cleanliness is severely lacking, and the water quality is poor, making it an unappealing spot for visitors.

Swimming is not allowed, as there are multiple warning signs citing dangerous depths, which further limits the recreational appeal of this place. Overall, it's one of the worst beach experiences I've had.

I sincerely hope the local authorities take action to improve the condition of the beach‚Äîboth in terms of cleanliness and safety‚Äîso it can become a more enjoyable destination in the future.

This beach is a hidden gem ‚Äî little far from the city but peaceful and less crowded, perfect for a relaxing getaway. The sunset views are absolutely stunning, and the water is remarkably clear. While there aren‚Äôt any major restaurants nearby, you'll find plenty of street food options to satisfy your cravings. Another plus is the ample parking space, which makes visiting hassle-free.

The surrounding hills are covered with lush greenery, adding to the scenic beauty of the beach.Yarada Beach is less crowded compared to other commercial beaches, making it an ideal spot for relaxation and quality time with family and friends.The beach's untouched beauty and serene atmosphere make it an attractive destination for those seeking a peaceful getaway.
If someone prefers peace and privacy and doesn‚Äôt like crowded places, then this spot is really, really good ‚Äî perfect for a quiet escape.

Beautiful beach ‚õ±Ô∏è which is a hidden gem
Away from the crowd
Hiking to the mountain side for sea view is just awesome
Natural Beauty: The beach is renowned for its pristine golden sands, clear blue waters, and surrounding hills, making it an ideal spot for nature lovers and photographers  .

placeMetadata.name: Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse

sources.snippet: One of Visakhapatnam‚Äôs most beloved tourist spots, Dolphin‚Äôs Nose, is truly a sight to behold. The name is derived from the shape of the large rock formation itself, which does resemble a dolphin‚Äôs nose in profile when viewed from afar. At an altitude of 174 meters above sea level, you‚Äôll be able to catch fascinating views of the bustling city at one end, and at the other you can watch the serene comings and goings of ships along the coast.

sources.snippet: Dolphin‚Äôs Nose Lighthouse is situated on a hill shaped like a dolphin‚Äôs nose, offering stunning views and one of the best things to do in Visakhapatnam and the coastline. Standing at 174 metres above sea level, the lighthouse is a crucial landmark for navigation. It is surrounded by lush greenery and provides a calm environment for visitors.

placeMetadata.description: Scenic destination featuring an old lighthouse offering panoramic vistas of the city & ocean.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse is a popular tourist destination located on the Gangavaram port of Vizag, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city and ocean. The name is derived from the large rock viewpoint that resembles a dolphin's nose shape. This 174-meter-high headland provides stunning vistas of the coastline and lush green hills.
placeMetadata.address: Dolphin Hill, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 530005, India

reviews.reviewText:
It is a must visit place in vizag. The experience is amazing. The view is breathtaking. The timings are restricted from 3PM - 5PM only, so plan accordingly.

It is located towards the south of vizag, roughly 25km from RK beach. The way goes through industrial areas, military areas and a steep ghat road. The ghat road journey can be a little tough with sharp turns, speed breakers, steep road and bumpy patches.

Once you reach the entrance, there is a good parking area and you can buy the entry ticket. From there you need to walk around 200-300m to the main lighthouse. From there you need to climb around 70 normal steps and 10-12 steps in a ladder to reach the top.

The view is just breathtaking and very wholesome. The wind will be strong, so take care of your belongings. And walk slowly as there is less area to roam on the top. Cellphone signals will be weak here.

Dolphin‚Äôs Nose Lighthouse, perched atop Dolphin‚Äôs Nose hill (Yarada Hills) in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, is an iconic maritime landmark offering breathtaking coastal views and historical significance.

You can come here via public transport which is very less to this place or via private vehicles (recommend).
I went here via scooty which gives an amazing experience.
A few places are available for the public as most of the place is acquired by the Indian Navy.
The place is full of historical and cultural significance.
At main enty a fee of 10 will be collected and vehicle details would be captured.
Timing of this place is very much crucial so be on time that is 3-5pm
You will get an amazing experience with mesmerizing view.
One more thing. However there is a small shop and bathroom but if possible bring your own thing with you.

The Dolphin‚Äôs Nose Lighthouse is one of Vizag‚Äôs hidden gems and absolutely worth a visit. Perched on a rocky headland, the lighthouse offers a spectacular panoramic view of the coastline and the vast Bay of Bengal. The sweeping sight of the blue waters meeting the rugged shoreline is truly breathtaking and makes the climb worthwhile.

The area around the lighthouse is calm and less crowded, which adds to the charm. It‚Äôs a great spot for photography, relaxation, or simply soaking in the refreshing sea breeze. The vantage point also gives visitors a unique perspective of Vizag‚Äôs natural beauty, blending hills, sea, and port views all in one frame. Do take note of the visiting time on the day of your visit. Its 3pm-5pm.
Security is kind of strict in the area for obvious reasons.

For those exploring the city, the Dolphin‚Äôs Nose Lighthouse is a must-visit destination to experience the scenic grandeur of the coast

Exquisite vista from lighthouse, lush green in rainy season + a little gloomy on the day i visited. Super windy and surreal. Must visit for a fresh breather. Historical and educational frames as you enter the house, do read to get an idea of light houses in the world.

The lighthouse is situated on a rocky headland that resembles a dolphin's nose, creating a natural wonder that's both fascinating and picturesque.The lighthouse is surrounded by lush greenery and rugged terrain, creating a peaceful and serene atmosphere that's perfect for relaxation.The Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse is a unique and fascinating destination that offers a mix of natural beauty, maritime significance, and panoramic views.
Dolphins light house is a view point which is on the way towards yarada beach. You can have a beautiful view of yarada beach from here.

Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse: A Vizag Gem with Room for Improvement (and a Few Quirks)

Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse offers an undeniably nice atmosphere with amazing views that are well worth the visit. Perched atop the iconic Dolphin's Nose hill, the panoramic vistas of the Bay of Bengal, the sprawling Vizag coastline, and the surrounding lush greenery are simply breathtaking. It's a fantastic spot to enjoy the sea breeze, capture stunning photographs, and simply soak in the natural beauty of the region.
However, the experience does come with a few notable caveats. During my visit, the entry was open but the lighthouse itself was not accessible, and there was no explanation provided. This was quite disappointing, as the opportunity to explore the lighthouse interior and potentially ascend for an even higher vantage point is a significant draw. Clear signage or a staff member on hand to explain the closure would greatly enhance the visitor experience.
There is a nominal entry fee of ‚Çπ10 per person, which is quite reasonable for the views on offer. A practical point to note for future visitors is that only cash is accepted for entry fees. In an increasingly digital world, the lack of UPI or other e-commerce payment provisions feels outdated and inconvenient. Having to scramble for cash can detract from the initial excitement of arrival.
Additionally, should the lighthouse be open during your visit, be prepared to remove your shoes for entry. While this isn't a major inconvenience, it's good to be aware of beforehand, especially if you're wearing footwear that's difficult to slip on and off.
Despite these minor frustrations and quirks, the sheer beauty of the location makes Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse a recommended stop in Vizag. If the operational aspects, particularly the consistent accessibility of the lighthouse and payment options, could be improved, it would undoubtedly elevate this already picturesque destination to a truly top-tier attraction.
Really amazing place to view all of vizag. Entry fee ‚Çπ10. Not too much to see here so doesn‚Äôt take much time.

placeMetadata.name: Ross Hill Church

sources.snippet: Ross Hill Church stands on top of Ross Hill, which is the highest peak within Vizag. This church provides panoramic views overlooking the city and harbor while not only serving as a religious structure for worshiping purposes. The church's colonial architecture contrasts sharply with its surroundings making it an interesting subject matter for architectural photographers who want something distinctive from their usual shots.

Situated on top of the central hill is the Ross Hill Church, an impressive structure in Vizag that should not be missed by anyone visiting this beautiful port city. The best part of visiting Ross Hill Church is the panoramic view of the city and the horizon is sure to amaze you.

reviews.reviewText:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Rose Hill Church is hands-down one of the most breathtaking spots in the city! üåä‚õ™ Sitting high on the hill, the church itself is peaceful and charming, but the real magic begins when you step outside and look at the view. The entire coastline opens up in front of you ‚Äî you can literally watch huge cargo ships, cruise liners, and even naval vessels passing by. If you‚Äôre lucky, you might catch a submarine surfacing or a naval practice session happening right in the ocean below. It feels like a live maritime show! üö¢‚öì

The place is super calm, with a refreshing sea breeze and plenty of open space to just sit, relax, and take it all in. It‚Äôs perfect for photography, quiet reflection, or just watching the world (and ships!) go by. Early mornings and evenings are the best time to visit ‚Äî the light makes everything look golden and magical. üåÖ

Whether you‚Äôre a tourist or a local, Rose Hill Church is a must-visit if you love scenic views, history, and the ocean. Highly recommended! üëç

Ross Hill Church, perched high above Visakhapatnam‚Äôs harbor, is more than just a religious site‚Äîit's a serene retreat with one of the best views in the city. The church itself is modest but well-kept, offering a calm and quiet atmosphere perfect for reflection or a moment of silence. What sets this spot apart is the stunning vantage point. From the church grounds, you can look out over the port, city skyline, and coastline. It‚Äôs especially beautiful at sunset, when the light spills over the hills and sea. The journey up the hill, though a bit steep, is worth every step for the peaceful environment and the views.

Rose Hill Church is a serene and picturesque destination located at the top of a hill, offering a peaceful escape from the daily hustle. The uphill walk takes around 10 minutes and is fairly manageable, though a bit of a workout. For those who prefer a more comfortable ascent, autos are readily available at the base of the hill, and you can also drive up with your own vehicle.

The view from the top is absolutely stunning ‚Äî a panoramic sweep of the surrounding area that makes the climb worthwhile. What makes this spot even more special is the presence of not just the church, but also a mosque and a shrine nearby, all coexisting peacefully on the same hill. It adds a unique spiritual and cultural charm to the place.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to spend some quiet time in reflection, take in the view, or just enjoy a peaceful walk, Rose Hill Church is a great spot to unwind. Highly recommended for a relaxing outing.

On the same hill in Visakhapatnam, a Hindu temple, a Catholic Church, and a Muslim Dargah stand as symbols of religious unity in India.
The surrounding picturesque locations are equally captivating. A visit to this location is highly recommended, particularly for those residing in the city of Destiny, Vizag.

Ross Hill Church is a great Tourist Spot and is highly recommended for a visit! Place got excellent Hilltop views gazing across the mountains and the sea. The Church itself has it's own cultural history originally founded by St. Francis De Sales. The church is very close to swami venkateshwara temple as well.

A peaceful, scenic gem built around 120 years ago. A wonderful place to visit‚Äîsee temple, mosque, and church within a frame, and take in sweeping views of the port, ships, and city.
Visit early morning or around sunset for the best light and cooler weather.Drive up if possible‚Äîvehicles can reach the top, avoiding a steep climb.

Very beautiful and calm place, it‚Äôs scenic and you can see the religious harmony having temple and masjid at the same place , view of port from here is spectacular, u just need vehicle to reach here private vehicle will be a good option, festival is celebrated during December month

My go to place when heart feels heavy, happy or just empty.

This is apparently named the entry point into vizag (by sea)nand if that wasn't enough to make it important - this hill stands as a breathing symbol of religious amalgamation and secularism the city embraces.  With a mosque, a temple and the church all on the same hill, this holds mirror to the peace & harmony the city thrives on.

It's not just the views that are spectacular but perhaps the thousands of prayers that rise up to heaven from this place is what makes it a safe haven for a tired soul. Oh and the stunning photogenic vistas too!

reviews.reviewText:
Indira Gandhi Zoological Park in Visakhapatnam is a must-visit destination for wildlife enthusiasts and families. Spread across 625 acres, it's one of the largest zoos in India, housing around 843 animals from 123 species.

- *Natural Setting*: The zoo is nestled in the Eastern Ghats, providing a natural habitat for the animals.
- *Variety of Animals*: Visitors can spot tigers, lions, elephants, giraffes, and various bird species.
- *Conservation Efforts*: The zoo is involved in breeding programs for endangered species like the Asiatic wild dog.
- *Educational Programs*: The zoo offers educational activities and workshops for children and adults.
- *Food Options*: Some visitors have reported limited food options within the zoo.
- *Crowd Management*: The zoo can get crowded, especially on weekends and
- *Plan Ahead*: Check the zoo's timings and entry fees before visiting.
- *Wear Comfortable Shoes*: The zoo is spread over a large area, so wear comfortable shoes for walking.
- *Bring Water and Snacks*: While there are food options available, it's a good idea to bring

The zoo was completely clean and well maintained. I saw animals like Tiger, Lion, jackals, crocodiles, cheetah, deer, elephants, various types of birds and many more. I went in a cool weather which made the place look more attractive. Animals are being taken care properly by the authorities. Inside there are places to have ice cream, tea or coffee. The place is worth visiting for wildlife lovers.

Vizag Zoo Park
We recently visited Vizag Zoo Park with our family, and it was a wonderful experience! We saw a wide variety of animals including tigers, white tigers, elephants, giraffes, crocodiles, snakes, lions, deer, and even an anaconda. The kids were especially excited to see the different species of birds, peacocks, and tortoises.

We chose to explore the entire zoo on foot, which allowed us to enjoy the natural beauty and greenery all around. It was a refreshing and peaceful walk, and a great way to connect with nature while learning about wildlife.

We also visited the butterfly zone, which looked nice, but unfortunately there were no butterflies at the time. That was a bit disappointing, but overall it didn‚Äôt take away from the experience.

The zoo is well-maintained and perfect for a family outing. My kids really enjoyed everything, and we had a great time together. Highly recommended for a fun and educational day out in nature

I visited this zoo around 10 years ago, and recently revisited it ‚Äî I was genuinely amazed by how much it's changed! The transformation is unbelievable. The zoo is now home to a wide variety of animals, and the overall experience has been significantly upgraded.

The infrastructure is impressive, with beautifully maintained greenery throughout. There are plenty of benches and shaded areas under large trees, making it a very comfortable place to rest as you explore.

Despite the hot weather outside, the zoo felt pleasantly cool thanks to the abundance of trees and plants, which really enhance the environment and provide a natural cooling effect.

The zoo also has free drinking water stations at multiple spots, which is a thoughtful and much-needed facility, especially during warmer months.

There‚Äôs a canteen inside the zoo too. I tried the chicken biryani, which was surprisingly tasty. They also serve meals, though I found those to be just average in taste.

For convenience, the zoo offers traveller vehicles and electric cycles, which are great for covering the large area without getting too tired.

Overall, it‚Äôs a fantastic place to hang out with family or friends. Whether you're there for the animals, the peaceful greenery, or just a relaxing day out, this zoo has truly become a great destination. Highly recommended!

The best visit time is around 11 to 11:30 AM as it is the feeding time for the animals.

Visited Indira Gandhi Zoological Park recently, and it‚Äôs a wonderful place to explore with children and family.

‚úÖ Wide Variety of Animals ‚Äì The zoo has White Lions, Tigers, Monkeys, Parrots, Tortoises, and many other wild animals. It‚Äôs a great learning experience, especially for kids.

‚úÖ Good Environment ‚Äì The park is spacious, and walking around gives you a real jungle-like feel.

‚ö†Ô∏è Suggestion for Improvement: In the parrot section, the birds are not clearly visible due to white glass panels. It would be better if they used mesh or transparent barriers instead, to allow better viewing while ensuring safety.

Overall, a great outing spot with lots to see and learn. With a few small improvements, it can become one of the best zoological parks in the region!

The Vizag Zoo is a well-planned and thoughtfully designed zoo that offers visitors an enjoyable experience amidst nature. Spread out across a large area, it features a wide variety of animal exhibits that are both educational and engaging. The enclosures are generally spacious, allowing the animals to move freely and providing visitors with a closer-to-natural experience.

One of the main highlights of the zoo is undoubtedly the White Bengal Tigers. These majestic animals are a major attraction, and watching them up close is a memorable experience.

Visitors can choose between driving through the zoo in their own car or opting for a personal buggy ride, which makes it convenient for families and those who prefer a guided, comfortable tour. To fully explore the zoo and its exhibits, it usually takes around 2‚Äì3 hours.

At the same time, certain sections of the zoo are undergoing upgrading and renovation works, which is a positive sign of continuous improvement. Once completed, these will further enhance the visitor experience and the welfare of the animals.

Overall, Vizag Zoo strikes a fine balance between recreation and conservation, making it a great place for families, animal lovers, and tourists alike.

placeMetadata.name: VMRDA INS Kursura Submarine Museum

sources.snippet: You‚Äôll find the Submarine Museum (or ‚ÄòSmritika‚Äô) standing prominently against the stunning backdrop of Ramakrishna beach. The first of its kind in all of South Asia, the INS (Indian Naval Service) Kurusura Submarine was a Soviet built-I-641 class Submarine, which after 31 years of service was decommissioned and converted into a fascinating museum for the public. There are six guides and a curator to inform and educate visitors about the complex workings of the submarine, and the simple experience of being inside a sub is a thrilling novelty.

INS Kursura Submarine Museum ‚Äì A Fascinating Dive into Naval History

The INS Kursura Submarine Museum is an absolute must-visit if you're in Visakhapatnam. Stepping inside the actual decommissioned submarine gives a rare and thrilling glimpse into the life of naval officers underwater. It's not just a museum ‚Äì it feels like stepping into a preserved piece of living history.

The submarine itself is compact and impressive. As you move through the narrow corridors and peek into the control rooms, torpedo bays, and sleeping quarters, you can‚Äôt help but admire the bravery and discipline of the crew who once lived and worked here for months at a time.
The museum staff, many of whom are ex-navy personnel, do an excellent job explaining the submarine‚Äôs operations and sharing fascinating stories about life under the sea.

From a technical, historical, and emotional perspective, the INS Kursura offers a deeply enriching experience. It‚Äôs also beautifully maintained, right by the beach, making it a perfect blend of education and a day out by the sea.

Tip: Visit in the evening for a cooler experience and enjoy the illuminated view of the submarine at night!

The INS Kursura Submarine Museum is one of the most fascinating attractions in Vizag and a must-visit for history and defense enthusiasts. Housed inside a real decommissioned submarine, the museum gives visitors a rare opportunity to step into the life of naval officers and sailors who once served at sea.

Walking through the narrow passages, control rooms, and crew quarters offers a deep appreciation of the discipline, courage, and challenges faced by submariners. The displays are informative and well-curated, showcasing the submarine‚Äôs operations, equipment, and legacy.

The highlight is the chance to experience firsthand the compact living and working conditions inside a submarine, which leaves you with immense respect for the Indian Navy. Its location along RK Beach adds to the appeal, making it easy to combine with a beachside stroll.

Overall, the INS Kursura Submarine Museum is an educational, unique, and memorable experience that offers both adults and children a glimpse into India‚Äôs rich naval history

"I'm absolutely thrilled to give Bheemili Beach a well-deserved 5-star review! This stunning beach has stolen my heart with its pristine beauty, picturesque surroundings, and warm village hospitality.

Firstly, the beach itself is incredibly clean and well-maintained. The sand is soft, the waters are calm, and the scenery is simply breathtaking. It's the perfect spot to relax, unwind, and soak up the sun.

But what truly sets Bheemili Beach apart is its stunning location within a beautiful village. The surrounding landscape is dotted with lush greenery, quaint cottages, and winding roads that seem to whisper stories of the past. It's a truly immersive experience that will leave you enchanted.

And just when I thought it couldn't get any better, I discovered the newly opened Coco Arena! This incredible spot is surrounded by majestic coco trees that provide the most wonderful shade during the scorching summer months. It's the perfect spot to escape the heat and enjoy the cool ocean breeze.

I've visited many beaches in my life, but Bheemili Beach stands out for its unique blend of natural beauty, village charm, and modern amenities. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this beach is an absolute must-visit. Five stars isn't enough ‚Äì I'd give it ten stars if I could!

*Pros:* Pristine beach, picturesque village surroundings, newly opened Coco Arena with coco trees providing shade

*Cons:* None!

*Recommendation:* Head to Bheemili Beach for a day of relaxation, exploration, and fun in the sun. Don't forget to visit the Coco Arena for a truly unforgettable experience!"

placeMetadata.name: Thotlakonda Buddhist Monastery

Such hilltop locations have picturesque views over these landscapes as well as the sea which makes it an ideal location to capture historical scenes along with scenery.

sources.snippet: Also known as 'the Hill of Eagles', the complex has a number of stupas, Chaityas, Viharas, a congregation hall and a refectory belonging to the Hinayana school, mostly excavated during1982-92. Excavations at Thotlakonda comprise pottery, beads, bangle pieces, tiles, stuccos, iron objects, sculptural remains, moulded bricks, inscriptions, coins, etc.

reviews.reviewText: Very peaceful, not a lot of crowd. Well maintained space. Route is scenic and the guard was helpful and explained the history of the place. This monastery used to be inhabited by monks thousands of years ago and the ruins are since then. The entry fee is quite minimal. There is a nice view point here which gives you panoramic views of the city and shoreline.

I really enjoyed the thotlakonda monastery ruins. Free entrance although you need to pay some charges while entering the road which leads to this. The signboards are quite informative and the place is free from guides. So you can just explore the beautiful and peaceful place on your own, the little signboards provide enough information to enjoy the place. The signboard outside gives a brief history of the place as well. Easily can covered in half an hour as the place is not very big.

This monastery is used by monks in 200BC. There is no special entry ticket, there will be a guide at the entrance who will explain the history and details of the place. You can give him a fee as per your wish. One should go up the ghat road to reach here. There is a small park nearby with a great view, definitely visit it on your way back.

There is no special parking area, but there is a decent open area where you can park your vehicle. There is an entry fee for the vehicle at the entrance of the hill.

The park there has a nice view of the beach, but the ancient part isn‚Äôt that interesting. However, for people who like history and enjoy visiting historical places, this place would be a good choice.

What a marvel from 2,000 years ago! Must visit for history lovers. Absolute peace and bliss!

The ghat road leading to the monastery site (atop a hill) is well maintained but has a small entry charge at the main gate. There‚Äôs some space to park vehicles up the hill, just beside the monument site.

The cluster of monuments has been very well maintained by the Archaeology Department. The plaque at the entry informs that the Indian Navy spotted this site in the 1970s while on the lookout for a suitable naval base, and its discovery has improved the understanding of Buddhism in the Eastern Ghats region. There weren‚Äôt any guides, although the security personnel offered some information.

The site is pretty self-explanatory for those familiar with history and Buddhism, but I would love to see some more curated digital media guides that could help other tourists.

reviews.reviewText:
In the month of March, I had the opportunity to visit Rushikonda Beach in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, with my close friend Ayush. It turned out to be one of the most enjoyable and refreshing experiences of our trip. Known for its natural beauty and clean shoreline, Rushikonda Beach is truly a gem on the east coast.

The beach was lively yet peaceful, with golden sands and clear blue waters creating a stunning view. The gentle waves and cool breeze made it a perfect spot to relax and unwind. We spent a good amount of time walking along the shore, chatting, and soaking in the serene atmosphere.

What made the experience even better was the scenic drive to the beach. Surrounded by lush greenery and coastal roads, the journey itself was quite beautiful. The beach is also a great place for water sports like jet skiing and surfing, which adds excitement for adventure lovers, though we mainly went there to enjoy the peaceful vibe.

Food stalls near the beach served tasty local snacks, allowing us to enjoy a light meal while enjoying the sea view. The beach was clean and well-maintained, which made our visit even more pleasant.

Overall, Rushikonda Beach is a must-visit destination in Vizag for anyone who loves nature, sea views, and a relaxed vibe. It was a memorable experience that I‚Äôd highly recommend to others. I would love to visit again someday.

This is the only beach in Vizag where one can do swimming and also do water sports such as jet ski, speed boat and many more. This is also one of the most popular beaches among tourists. The beach is very lively and there are some good photogenic spots as well.

This is one of the best beaches of Vizag. The    sea current is usually gentle here, with a constant watch from the security, warning tourists venturing little inside the sea. A lot of families with kids and friends in groups make the most of this lovely sea coast playing in the serene beaches, enjoying the water rides, taking lovely photos, riding horses, and kids collecting sea shells.
Note that Scuba diving is open only in winters between Sep through Jan. On the other days, one can enjoy speed boats and speed scooter rides.
Note:
This beach does not have a facility  to shower. The facility that AP tourism provides is mostly non- functional; most of the time, there would be no water. So please make your own arrangements. The support staff at this facility are extremely arrogant and rude. Avoid this place.
There would be numerous photographers reaching out to you for snaps. Be very careful dealing with them.
Also, please be aware that the speed boat driver would usually ask for additional money to take you a little more inside the sea - don't encourage this. This is another trick to fool tourists and make more money.

Marvelous beach . Suitable for various activities.
You can fully enjoy the sea here , coast guards are always alert, you can take your family and happily spend some times

The beach itself is pristine and well-maintained, with plenty of space to soak up the sun, take a dip, or simply relax with family and friends. The scenic views of the surrounding landscape are simply breathtaking, especially during sunrise and sunset.

I've visited many beaches in my life, but Rushikonda Beach stands out for its unique blend of natural beauty, convenience, and amenities. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this beach is an absolute must-visit. Five stars isn't enough ‚Äì I'd give it ten stars if I could!

A must-visit tourist attraction on the Vizag tour, the Victory at Sea War Memorial generates a sense of patriotism as soon as you enter the place. Home to a wide variety of missiles, tankers and fighter plane models, the Sea War Memorial is a well-maintained memorial that attracts tourists from all around the world for its significance.

Constructed in the year 1996 in the honour of all Indian war martyrs, the Victory at Sea War Memorial boasts of an excellent location on the beach road and offers a pleasant atmosphere around the park to enjoy a day out with your friends and families. Here you can take a leisure walk in the morning and witness the mesmerizing view of the sunrise from the beach.

The Victory at Sea Memorial in Vizag is a compact, poignant, and thoughtfully located tribute to the Indian Navy and the sacrifices of naval personnel during the 1971 Indo-Pak War. It‚Äôs not a full, detailed museum ‚Äî but as an outdoor memorial, it does a good job of combining solemn remembrance with scenic waterfront ambiance, making it well-suited for short visits, personal reflection, or as part of a broader beach road walk.

If you‚Äôre traveling in Visakhapatnam, especially along Beach Road, the Victory at Sea Memorial is a worthy stop: not just for its historical resonance, but also for the peaceful, contemplative space it provides next to the sea. It pairs particularly well with visits to the Ramakrishna Beach and the INS Kurusura Submarine Museum, turning the walk into both a tour and a moment of remembering the naval heritage of the city.

Kailasagiri is a 173‚Äëmetre hilltop park in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, developed by VMRDA across roughly 380 acres of lush greenery  Ôøº. It‚Äôs a celebrated tourist destination‚Äînamed the state‚Äôs ‚ÄúBest Tourist Spot‚Äù in 2003‚Äîwith about 300,000 visitors annually  Ôøº.

üåÑ Highlights & Attractions
‚Ä¢	Shiva‚ÄìParvati Statue: A striking 40‚Äëft white marble statue depicting Lord Shiva and Parvati, giving the hill its name (‚ÄúKailasa giri‚Äù = abode of Shiva)  Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Panoramic Views: Multiple viewpoints provide sweeping vistas of the Bay of Bengal, Eastern Ghats, and Visakhapatnam cityscape  Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Ropeway: A scenic cable-car ride (first in Andhra Pradesh) ascends from the base to the top, offering 360¬∞ views  Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Floral Clock & Iconic Sculptures: Features a 10‚Äëm botanical clock and the Shanku Chakra Namam (Vishnu‚Äôs conch‚Äëdiscus)  Ôøº.
‚Ä¢	Recreational Facilities: Includes a toy train, jungle trails, children‚Äôs playground, paragliding, bicycle sky‚Äëtrack, and Titanic-view deck  Ôøº.

Visitor Experience

Visitors can reach the summit via winding roads or the ropeway. Pathways wind through manicured gardens, picnic spots, and vistas. According to tourists, the park is well-maintained, spiritually serene, and family-friendly‚Äîthough sometimes crowded  Ôøº

reviews.reviewText:
Today visited Matsya darsini at Ramakrishana beach. Enjoyed this place well. Multiple varieties of fishes and tortoises are displayed here in small and medium size aquariums.
There is no enough space for few fishes. And turtles are literally abused by not giving enough basking areas leading to shell rots . Poor turtle . He is having severe shell rot but no one there to take care.
The entrance is very odd in the sense that things are clumsy and not attractive.
Dark inside; more lighting could help
Suffocated feeling with no / poor air conditioning.

Matsya Darshini is an okay place to visit if you‚Äôre in Visakhapatnam and have some time to spare, but honestly, it doesn‚Äôt live up to expectations. While the aquarium is clean and well-maintained, the variety of fish is quite limited. You‚Äôd expect to see a wide range of marine life, but unfortunately, there aren‚Äôt many unique or exotic species on display.

For the ticket price, it doesn‚Äôt feel entirely worth it. The experience is too short, and there‚Äôs not much to explore. If you‚Äôre visiting with kids, they might find it interesting for a while, but don‚Äôt expect anything too exciting.

Overall, it‚Äôs decent for a one-time visit, but unless they add more fish and improve the exhibits, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend going out of your way to see it.

Please do not visit this place or encourage visiting this place as the fish and turtles have been kept in very pitiable condition.

It's a private aquarium, where you are charged 50 Rs as entry (that too only in cash!), and these are the shocking scenes you get to witness inside.

Since there's no record of official payments as you need to pay in cash, it's clear the receipts are being used for vested interest of the owner, and these voiceless fish and turtles are left to suffer inside.

There's no natural light inside the aquarium, 24 hours there are artifical lights burning on them, it feels like these creatures have been kept in a dungeon with no fresh air or oxygen to breathe.

Animal welfare activists of Vizag please take notice of this injustice. Every creature has a right to fresh air, sunlight, fresh water atleast if not medical care.

It was a heartbreaking experience visiting this place. I wonder when are humans going to be sensitized on the plight of animals.
It used to be one of the best few yrs before now in 25 it's not maintained well ,most of the tanks are empty n most of the fish species on tanks are named wrong. It was sad to see it that way

It could have been better. Very limited species of fish are showcased. No proper lighting. Darker and old rooms. No proper ventilation. The rooms, pathways and aquariums are not renovated. Its only a 5 minutes visit. Still they are charging Rs 50 per head.

It's not that good as expected, few white tiger sharks, black tiger sharks, piranha, few other aquarium fishes, turtles are point of view.. According to internal view experience the price is too high. It should be about 20 which is the best price. Cleanliness is not maintained, aquarium glasses are hazy and filled up with moss.

I will suggest to give this place a miss. Even though entry fee is only ‚Çπ50 but this place lacks maintenance, has limited space with no ventilation and poor lighting. It looks like you are in a cave. Not many marine life on display and most of tanks are either empty or are unclean. However Unlike other aquariums i have visited this one permits photography..
Good place to see different fishes from different regions.

Thotlakonda Beach in Vizag is truly a gem and great place that offers an unforgettable experience. Nestled near the historical site of Thotlakonda, this beach is a perfect blend of natural beauty and geological wonder. The highlight of my visit was the stunning natural arch at Mangamaripeta. This geological formation, sculpted by the relentless action of waves over thousands of years, is a testament to the awe-inspiring power of nature.

The beach itself is serene and less crowded, making it an ideal spot for those looking to escape the hustle and bustle of city life. The sound of the waves crashing against the rocks, coupled with the gentle sea breeze, creates a calming atmosphere that's perfect for relaxation. The natural arch, with its unique structure, is a photographer‚Äôs delight and a must-visit for geology enthusiasts.

Walking along the shoreline, I was captivated by the pristine beauty of the surroundings. The clear waters, golden sands, and lush greenery add to the scenic charm of Thotlakonda Beach. It‚Äôs not just a place to unwind but also a reminder of the incredible natural history of the region. I would highly recommend this beach to anyone visiting Visakhapatnam‚Äîit‚Äôs a place where nature and tranquility come together beautifully.

reviews.reviewText:
The MV MAA is an eerie yet intriguing sight along the shores of Visakhapatnam, a testament to the raw power of nature and the impermanence of man-made structures.

This Bangladeshi cargo ship ran aground during a cyclone in October 2020, leaving it stranded near the Tenneti Park beach.

The abandoned vessel has since become an unexpected tourist attraction, drawing curious visitors and photographers alike who are captivated by its rusting, massive structure juxtaposed against the tranquil sea.

The ship's presence is a stark reminder of the dangers faced by seafarers and adds a mysterious charm to Visakhapatnam's coastline.

This abundant ship is very beautiful, but the government is refurbishing the entire ship.And it does not look beautiful anymore. This abandoned ship is supposed to be of bangladesh and has been sitting here for quite some time. The real abandon shape and its rusty feel used to look very beautiful.But because of the current ongoing refurbishment done on the ship, it does not look that much attractive.
But one should not miss this place when in vishakhapatnam. This place can be visited during mornings or during the evenings as well.
Not much clealiness maintained by the authorities but this entire city and very beautiful and you would not want to miss visiting this place.

The vessel ‚ÄòMV MAA‚Äô is a cargo ship from Bangladesh which was abandoned in Andhra Pradesh and as the ship denied permission to dry dock and refloating attempts, the authorities thought of this. And now the ship has become a tourist attraction due to its proximity to the Tenneti Park in Andhra Pradesh. Visitors can see it closely from the Park, making it an ideal prospect for a floating restaurant or a hotel.üö¢üåä

A good site to visit to see on scale how a ship is to human size.

Located at the foothills of Kailasgiri and Tenneti park, this place has become one of the most visited tourist places in Vizag. This is a perfect example how an unfortunate incident can open the door towards positive turn of events. The bangladeshi cargo ship MV Maa ran aground during a cyclone in the year 2020 and was abandoned in the year 2021, as the owners of the ship were unable to tow it back. Since then, the ship has become a famous spot for photography, photoshoot and even filming movies. Although it‚Äôs not allowed to embark the ship, but the sight of the ship grounded on the shore is something that no one would like to miss. Overall verdict- definitely recommended.

This quaint town boasts rich historical significance, primarily due to the renowned Someswara Swamy Temple, which dates back to the 9th century AD. The temple is particularly notable for its impressive life-sized Nandi sculpture, making it a must-visit for those interested in spirituality and architecture.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Visakhapatnam, often affectionately called Vizag, is a coastal gem that beautifully blends natural beauty with rich history. From the stunning vistas at Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse to the serene ambiance of Lawsons Bay Beach Park, this city offers countless opportunities for capturing breathtaking moments. Whether you're standing atop the lush hills of Kailasgiri Park or exploring the ancient ruins at Thotlakonda, each corner of Vizag tells a story waiting to be photographed. The vibrant colors of the local culture and the picturesque landscapes make it a paradise for photography enthusiasts.

As you wander through the bustling streets and tranquil beaches, you'll discover a mix of iconic landmarks and hidden gems that are perfect for your next Instagram post. The Indira Gandhi Zoological Park showcases exotic wildlife, while the Victory At Sea War Memorial stands as a tribute to the city's naval heritage. With so many captivating spots to explore, Visakhapatnam invites you to grab your camera and embark on a visual journey through its stunning scenery and rich cultural tapestry.

sources.snippet: The Submarine Museum INS Kursura is one of the most unique attractions in Visakhapatnam. This museum is housed in a decommissioned submarine, the INS Kursura, which served the Indian Navy for 31 years. The submarine, a Kalvari-class diesel-electric type, played a vital role in the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971.

placeMetadata.description: Submarine museum & former navy vessel offering cabin tours by retired military personnel.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The VMRDA INS Kursura Submarine Museum, located on RK Beach in Visakhapatnam, is a popular tourist attraction. This museum features the INS Kurusura, a Russian-built submarine that was inducted into the Indian Navy in 1969 and decommissioned in 2001 after 31 years of service. It is the first submarine museum in Asia and the second in the world.
placeMetadata.address: P88J+V2W, RK Beach Rd, Kirlampudi Layout, Chinna Waltair, Pandurangapuram, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 530017, India

reviews.reviewText:
Must visit the spot. You can get a combo ticket which gives entry to the submarine, aircraft museum and sea harrier. They are all located in walkable distance near RK beach. Try to visit in the evening as it will be cool. There will be air conditioning throughout the tour, so no need to worry about ventilation.

There will be colourful lighting for submarine from the evening which will be a good view from opposite road.

There is no allocated car parking area around, but you can easily find bike parking on the pavement.

INS Kursura Submarine Museum ‚Äì A Fascinating Dive into Naval History

The INS Kursura Submarine Museum is an absolute must-visit if you're in Visakhapatnam. Stepping inside the actual decommissioned submarine gives a rare and thrilling glimpse into the life of naval officers underwater. It's not just a museum ‚Äì it feels like stepping into a preserved piece of living history.

The submarine itself is compact and impressive. As you move through the narrow corridors and peek into the control rooms, torpedo bays, and sleeping quarters, you can‚Äôt help but admire the bravery and discipline of the crew who once lived and worked here for months at a time.
The museum staff, many of whom are ex-navy personnel, do an excellent job explaining the submarine‚Äôs operations and sharing fascinating stories about life under the sea.

From a technical, historical, and emotional perspective, the INS Kursura offers a deeply enriching experience. It‚Äôs also beautifully maintained, right by the beach, making it a perfect blend of education and a day out by the sea.

Tip: Visit in the evening for a cooler experience and enjoy the illuminated view of the submarine at night!

The INS Kursura Submarine Museum is one of the most fascinating attractions in Vizag and a must-visit for history and defense enthusiasts. Housed inside a real decommissioned submarine, the museum gives visitors a rare opportunity to step into the life of naval officers and sailors who once served at sea.

Walking through the narrow passages, control rooms, and crew quarters offers a deep appreciation of the discipline, courage, and challenges faced by submariners. The displays are informative and well-curated, showcasing the submarine‚Äôs operations, equipment, and legacy.

The highlight is the chance to experience firsthand the compact living and working conditions inside a submarine, which leaves you with immense respect for the Indian Navy. Its location along RK Beach adds to the appeal, making it easy to combine with a beachside stroll.

Overall, the INS Kursura Submarine Museum is an educational, unique, and memorable experience that offers both adults and children a glimpse into India‚Äôs rich naval history

The museum plays a significant role in imparting knowledge about submarines and showcases the life inside a submarine and hardships faced by the submariners in the sea. This well-maintained museum is a great mode of entertainment as well as knowledge. It is a must visit tourist spot in Vizag.

placeMetadata.name: King George Hospital

sources.snippet: The King George Hospital (KGH) has been an icon of medical assurance for Vizag and its surrounding areas right since the day it opened its doors in 1923. Affiliated to the Andhra Medical College, this government hospital is equipped with technologically advanced equipment like the Nuclear Medicine block and Dialysis Unit, staffed with highly skilled and experienced staff. The main building is a monumental structure, built around 1845 on a 35-acre land donated by the Budhavarapu family.
sources.shortName: 5 iconic structures in Visakhapatnam you need to know about

sources.snippet: The three-story stone masonry structure is built on a symmetrical plan with a central corridor and entrance towards the north. The entire construction was made of dressed stone masonry. To the extreme north of the entrance, the corridor is constructed as a four-story avenue where the fourth floor houses a clock.
sources.shortName: Architecture of Indian Cities: Visakhapatnam- The Steel City

King George hospital (KGH) is a government hospital which is the main and major hospital for three districts like Visakhapatnam, Vizianagaram Srikakulam.
It has a long history and which was built in the British ruling time.
Recently I visited the op gate for my relatives. I would like to share my experience with you all.

Two years back when I visited they gave nice treatment but unfortunately when I visited the op dept(op gate) recently , I observed a lot of delay while giving treatment to the patient.

We can see mostly junior doctors/trainees from AP medical college on the floor of op department while giving treatment. It's very hard to find senior doctors on the floor especially on the weekends.

Due to lack of experience and knowledge junior doctors take a lot of time for decision making to give what kind of treatment to patient. If there is a senior doctor on the floor, all junior doctors are following them and leaving some of the patients.

Some of the patients come for general and normal problems but jr. Doctors unable to tell where to go. They simply say sit on the bed and we'll come and see. Even after an hour also they said give us sometime, we'll  come.

Coming to the lab and report related, jr.doctor not sure exactly what is the problem . At the time these doctors sending the images/reports through WhatsApp and asking the decision. Then senior doctors  sending medical description and suggestions what to do. Then jr.doctors convey the same thing to patients.

Here I have seen some doctors, crossing their limits and giving lectures to the patients. Even they call other doctors in a disrespectful manner in front of patients.

Doctors prescribed medicine like 10 different tablets, out of 10 only 8 tablets giving in the medicine counters. Expensive tablets, staff asking us to buy outside. This is a government hospital they should provide free of cost.

My humble request to Government, Please looks into these issues. It could be better if you improve the hospitality and how doctors are given the treatment.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Bavikonda Ancient Buddhist Monastery, situated near Visakhapatnam, is an important historical site dating back to the 3rd century BCE. The name Bavikonda, meaning Hill of Wells, originates from the numerous wells on the hill used for collecting rainwater. This archaeological site boasts various artifacts such as Roman and Satavahana coins, pottery dating back to 3rd century BC and 2nd Century AD.
placeMetadata.address: R99R+39P, Kapuluppada, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 531163, India

reviews.reviewText: Great place for knowing the Buddhist timeline.

Can you believe they built 2 interpretation centers on this hill for this now abandoned tourism site! Even the Qutub shah heritage park in Hyderabad spread out over several acres has only one heritage center and it is much much smaller. why do they need two buildings on this hill? It is not even on the beach road! they pocketed public funds with help from the builder. The ultimate joke is now the centers have turned in to bigger ruins than the original Buddhist excavations on this hill.

A must-visit for history lovers.

The road leading to the site (which is atop a hill) was full of vegetation (huge tree branches ‚Ä¶) narrowing the path significantly ‚Äî definitely in need of some maintenance. There‚Äôs some space to park your vehicle just outside the site‚Äôs entrance.

The site, per se, is a marvel of those days! Those familiar with Buddhism and history would be able to appreciate it in its entirety. However, the site needs upkeep ‚Äî more information boards, proper gates, and personnel. I spotted a few visitors walking on the ancient structures; although I asked them not to, there‚Äôs clearly a need for security personnel.

Thotlakonda, on the other hand, was very well maintained.

Hope the Archaeology Department steps in.

This monument is closed. Bavikonda is under the Andhra Pradesh Archeology Department after 10 years of excavation and restoration to bring it alive now they have abandoned it and it is going back to its 1977 ruins it is shameful. We should be grateful that at least some of the monuments in this state are under the management of ASI like Bojjannakonda and Lingalakonda, Salihundam etc they do a superb job of preserving them, it is a joy to visit the sites managed by them makes you proud you are an Indian.

Poor maintenance. It's grass all over and all name plates rusted and nothing to read when I visited (Saturday, 18th January 2025). There are half a dozen visitors at the site, disappointed at the state of affairs. Goat grazing is active and they are plenty there.

It's one of the ancient Buddhist Monastery located very close to the other beautifully maintained Thotlakonda Monastery.  Although this is much larger, there is no entrance or parking fee, located slightly interior with clear paths however not maintained as well as Thotlakonda.

Buddhism is one of the oldest religions in the world, originating about a thousand years ago. Lord Buddha, the founder of the religion, believed in peace and prosperity which were essentially the principles of the religion. Birthing in India, the remnants of the religion‚Äôs glorious past still exists and one of these is the Bavikonda Ancient Buddhist Monastery.

reviews.reviewText:
"I'm absolutely delighted to give RK Beach a well-deserved 5-star review! This stunning beach has become my go-to spot for relaxation and fun in the sun.

Firstly, the beach's proximity to public transport makes it incredibly easy to get to, even for those without their own vehicles. The convenience factor is a huge plus in my book!

Once you arrive, you'll be spoiled for choice with the vast array of snacks available. From crispy street food to refreshing coconut water, and from spicy local delicacies to sweet treats, there's something for every taste and craving. I was impressed by the variety and quality of the snacks on offer!

The beach itself is beautifully maintained, with clean sand, calm waters, and picturesque views. It's the perfect spot to unwind, take a leisurely stroll, or simply enjoy quality time with family and friends.

I've visited RK Beach multiple times, and each time I'm impressed by its charm and character. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this beach is an absolute must-visit. Five stars isn't enough ‚Äì I'd give it ten stars if I could!

*Pros:* Easily accessible, variety of snacks, well-maintained beach, picturesque views

*Cons:* None!

*Recommendation:* Head to RK Beach for a day of relaxation, fun, and sun. You won't regret it!"
The beach is okay but there are better beaches in the city. The beach road is amazing though, and all the museums are located around here.

I recently visited RK Beach in Vizag with my family, and it was truly an amazing experience! We went there around 9 PM and ended up staying until 1:30 in the morning ‚Äî that‚Äôs how beautiful and peaceful the place was. Time just flew by without us even realizing it.

The night view of the beach was simply fantastic. The sound of the sea waves, the cool breeze, and the reflection of the moon on the water created a magical atmosphere. It was a perfect night for relaxation and quality family time. There were many other families there too, enjoying the calm and safe environment.

My kids had a great time playing on the sand and watching the waves. The beach was lively but not too crowded, which made it even more enjoyable. One of the best things was that even at night, there were small stalls available for snacks, tea, and coffee ‚Äî perfect for keeping warm and refreshed.

Overall, it was a memorable night by the sea. RK Beach is definitely a must-visit spot in Vizag, especially if you want to spend peaceful, happy moments with your loved ones. We‚Äôre already planning to come back again soon!

I'd recommend this place for sure. üèñÔ∏è

Loved the overall vibe ‚Äî calm, clean, and scenic. Whether you're a local or a tourist, RK Beach is a must-visit spot to unwind and soak in nature's beauty. üíôüìç Highly recommend visiting during early morning or sunset hours for the best experience.

RK Beach offers a blend of coastal beauty, cultural sites, and leisure options. It's a peaceful, scenic spot perfect for walks and sunsets.While generally pleasant during daylight, currents can be strong. Stick close to shore and ideally swim during supervised hours.
Nearby area to visit: the Ramakrishna Mission ashram, Dolphin's Nose, Visakha Museum, Kali Temple, and urban attractions like VUDA Park.

I visited RK Beach in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, in the month of March with my close friend Ayush, and it was a memorable experience overall. We reached the beach early in the morning to enjoy the peaceful atmosphere and cool breeze. The sound of the waves and the sunrise created a beautiful and calming start to our day.

However, one major downside was our experience with the local photographers on the beach. We were scammed by a few of them who overcharged us and delivered very poor-quality photos. Their behavior was rude and unprofessional. I strongly recommend that visitors avoid getting their pictures clicked by the beachside photographers, as most of them are not trustworthy and lack basic manners.

Aside from that, we had a great time. We walked along the beach, explored nearby streets, and took in the stunning coastal views. The area around the beach has a lively yet relaxed vibe. In the evening, we returned to the beach and sat by the shore, watching the waves and enjoying the cool breeze. The view during sunset was absolutely beautiful and added to the overall charm of the place.

Despite the issue with the photographers, our visit to RK Beach was fun and enjoyable. It‚Äôs a great spot for both early morning and evening visits. The natural beauty of the beach is worth experiencing. Just be a bit cautious with the photographers, and you‚Äôll have a great time.

Dedicated to the Indian Navy, Victory at Sea War Memorial is one of its own kind of memorial in South India that gives you a chance to pay respect to the courageous soldiers who fought for their country during the Indo-Pak war back in 1971.

A must-visit tourist attraction on the Vizag tour, the Victory at Sea War Memorial generates a sense of patriotism as soon as you enter the place. Home to a wide variety of missiles, tankers and fighter plane models, the Sea War Memorial is a well-maintained memorial that attracts tourists from all around the world for its significance.

Constructed in the year 1996 in the honour of all Indian war martyrs, the Victory at Sea War Memorial boasts of an excellent location on the beach road and offers a pleasant atmosphere around the park to enjoy a day out with your friends and families. Here you can take a leisure walk in the morning and witness the mesmerizing view of the sunrise from the beach.

**TU 142 Aircraft Museum ‚Äì Family Visit ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞**

During our recent trip to Visakhapatnam, we visited the TU 142 Aircraft Museum located near RK Beach, close to the HPCL Colony. It was an exciting and educational experience for our whole family. The museum is centered around the decommissioned TU 142M aircraft, a long-range maritime patrol and anti-submarine warfare aircraft used by the Indian Navy.

The aircraft, now on display, has been beautifully preserved. We were amazed by its massive size and advanced features for its time. Inside the museum, there are several informative exhibits about the aircraft‚Äôs history, its role in Indian defense, and the technology used. The children especially enjoyed the interactive screens and videos that explained how the aircraft operated.

The museum is well-maintained, with clean surroundings and helpful staff. We also appreciated the neatly arranged photo gallery and the short documentary that gave us more insights into naval aviation.

Overall, it was a fun and educational outing for all of us. The visit gave us a sense of pride in our nation‚Äôs defense achievements. We highly recommend the TU 142 Museum to families visiting Vizag ‚Äì it's a great combination of learning and enjoyment.üëåüëçü§ùü§ùü§ùü•∞

In March, I had the pleasure of visiting the 142 Aircraft Museum in Visakhapatnam with a friend, and it turned out to be one of the most memorable experiences of our trip. Located right along the beautiful RK Beach and near the iconic INS Kurusura Submarine Museum, the aircraft museum offers a fascinating glimpse into Indian Naval aviation history.

The highlight of the museum is the HAL Tupolev Tu-142M aircraft, which served the Indian Navy for nearly three decades. Standing tall and majestic, the aircraft‚Äôs sheer size is impressive and commands attention. Inside the museum, we got to explore the aircraft's interior, including its cockpit, radar systems, and sonar room, all of which are preserved to reflect its operational condition. The exhibits and displays were informative and well-organized, with plenty of background on the aircraft‚Äôs missions, technology, and history.

What made the visit even more exciting was the proximity to the submarine museum, offering a rare chance to explore both naval air and underwater defense technology at one location. The setting by the beach added to the charm, making it perfect for a relaxed yet educational outing.

The staff was helpful, and the entry process was smooth. I‚Äôd highly recommend the 142 Aircraft Museum to anyone visiting Vizag‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre an aviation enthusiast, history buff, or just looking for a unique experience by the sea. It‚Äôs a tribute to India‚Äôs naval legacy and a proud piece of maritime history.

Ross Hill Church, perched high above Visakhapatnam‚Äôs harbor, is more than just a religious site‚Äîit's a serene retreat with one of the best views in the city. The church itself is modest but well-kept, offering a calm and quiet atmosphere perfect for reflection or a moment of silence. What sets this spot apart is the stunning vantage point. From the church grounds, you can look out over the port, city skyline, and coastline. It‚Äôs especially beautiful at sunset, when the light spills over the hills and sea. The journey up the hill, though a bit steep, is worth every step for the peaceful environment and the views.

Rose Hill Church is a serene and picturesque destination located at the top of a hill, offering a peaceful escape from the daily hustle. The uphill walk takes around 10 minutes and is fairly manageable, though a bit of a workout. For those who prefer a more comfortable ascent, autos are readily available at the base of the hill, and you can also drive up with your own vehicle.

The view from the top is absolutely stunning ‚Äî a panoramic sweep of the surrounding area that makes the climb worthwhile. What makes this spot even more special is the presence of not just the church, but also a mosque and a shrine nearby, all coexisting peacefully on the same hill. It adds a unique spiritual and cultural charm to the place.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to spend some quiet time in reflection, take in the view, or just enjoy a peaceful walk, Rose Hill Church is a great spot to unwind. Highly recommended for a relaxing outing.

On the same hill in Visakhapatnam, a Hindu temple, a Catholic Church, and a Muslim Dargah stand as symbols of religious unity in India.

What a marvel from 2,000 years ago! Must visit for history lovers. Absolute peace and bliss!

The ghat road leading to the monastery site (atop a hill) is well maintained but has a small entry charge at the main gate. There‚Äôs some space to park vehicles up the hill, just beside the monument site.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: St. John's Parish Church, located near the old post office in Vizag, is a significant historical landmark. Constructed during British colonial times, it was the first church built by the East India Company using its own funds and designed under the supervision of Sir Arthur Cotton. The church boasts architectural elements such as an Anglican dome, round pillars, and a preserved Madras roofing. It features Burma teak wood and stained glass from Europe, along with an ancient functional pipe organ.

A Shopper's Paradise in Gajuwaka: A Raving Review for CMR Central Mall
CMR Central Mall in Gajuwaka stands as a true landmark and a fantastic destination for shopping, entertainment, and dining in Visakhapatnam. For anyone in the Gajuwaka area looking for a comprehensive retail and leisure experience, this mall consistently delivers a positive and fulfilling visit.
One of the immediate strong points of CMR Central is its impressive range of shopping options. From popular apparel brands like Max, Reliance Trends, Mufti, and Levi's to electronics at Reliance Digital and home furnishings at Hometown, the mall caters to a diverse set of needs and preferences. Whether you're hunting for the latest fashion, updating your gadgets, or furnishing your home, you're likely to find what you're looking for under one roof. The quality of products generally aligns with good standards, and while some items might be on the higher end of the price spectrum, there are always reasonably priced options available.
Beyond just shopping, CMR Central truly excels as an entertainment hub. The INOX multiplex, with its multiple screens and comfortable seating, is a major draw, offering the latest cinematic releases. For those looking for more interactive fun, the mall boasts a large gaming zone equipped with modern VR and video games, appealing to both children and adults. And for a bit of friendly competition, the bowling alley is a fantastic addition, providing hours of enjoyment. This makes it an ideal spot for family outings or a fun evening with friends.
The dining options at CMR Central are equally impressive and diverse. The food court, often referred to as "Food Lounge," is a culinary haven, bringing together flavors from across India. You'll find popular fast-food chains like Ice creams, KFC, Burger King, and Pizza Hut, ensuring there's something for every craving. Whether you're in the mood for a quick bite or a more relaxed meal, the variety of choices is excellent.
The ambiance and maintenance of the mall are consistently good. The interiors are well-maintained, clean, and spacious, creating a comfortable and pleasant environment for visitors. The staff across various stores and facilities are generally polite and helpful, contributing to a positive customer experience. Even during busy periods, the mall manages to maintain a sense of order.
Furthermore, the convenience of accessibility to CMR Central in Gajuwaka is a significant advantage. Its location makes it easily reachable for residents in and around the area. Ample parking facilities for both two-wheelers and four-wheelers, including basement parking, alleviate the usual stress of finding a spot in a bustling urban area.
In summary, CMR Central Mall in Gajuwaka is more than just a shopping destination; it's a complete lifestyle center. With its extensive retail offerings, engaging entertainment avenues, diverse food court, and well-maintained premises, it consistently provides a great experience for all its visitors. It's truly a testament to a well-designed and well-managed mall that caters effectively to the needs of the community.

Anakapalli district is a district in the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It was formed on 4th April 2022 out of Anakapalli and Narsipatnam revenue divisions of the old Visakhapatnam district.The administrative headquarters are at Anakapalli.The district has two revenue divisions, namely Anakapalli and Narsipatnam, each headed by a sub collector.[6] These revenue divisions are divided into 25 mandals. The district consists of two municipalities and 8 census towns. Anakapalli zone fall under Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation and the two municipalities in the district are Elamanchili and Narsipatnam.[7] The census towns are Bowluvada, Chodavaram, Kantabamsuguda, Mulakuddu, Nakkapalle, Narsipatnam, Peda Boddepalle, Payakaraopeta.At the time of the 2011 census, Anakapalli district had a population of 1,726,998. Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes make up 158,060 (9.15%) and 47,975 (2.78%) of the population respectively.[1]:‚Ää90‚Äì94‚Ää Telugu was the predominant language, spoken by 98.87% of the population.There are one parliamentary and 7 assembly constituencies in Anakapalli district.

Jagadamba Theatre in Visakhapatnam is one of the most popular and iconic cinemas in the city. Here's a general review based on common visitor experiences:

### Pros:
- **Location**: Centrally located near Jagadamba Junction, which makes it easily accessible.
- **Ambience**: Known for its nostalgic charm, it has been a favorite for locals for decades. Despite the older structure, the theatre maintains a classic movie-watching experience.
- **Seating**: The seats are generally comfortable, though some areas could use refurbishment.
- **Sound and Screen**: It has a decent screen size and good sound quality. It has kept up with some modern audio technologies.
- **Ticket Pricing**: The ticket prices are quite reasonable compared to multiplexes, making it an affordable choice.

### Cons:
- **Parking**: Parking can be a challenge, especially during peak hours or when there‚Äôs a popular movie release.

In summary, Jagadamba Theatre is ideal for those who enjoy a traditional cinema-going experience at a reasonable price.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Visakhapatnam, often referred to as Vizag, is a city where the past and present beautifully intertwine, creating a unique architectural landscape that tells the story of its rich history and vibrant culture. From the impressive Gothic-style buildings of St. Aloysius' High School, which has educated generations since 1847, to the modern structures developed by renowned companies like MK Builders and VMRDA Properties, the city showcases a diverse range of architectural styles that reflect its growth and evolution over the years. Each corner of Vizag offers a glimpse into its architectural heritage, making it a fascinating destination for both history buffs and casual explorers alike.

As you wander through the streets of this coastal gem, you'll encounter not only significant landmarks like the Office of the District Collector and the Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation but also charming spots like Old Town Kulfi, where the essence of the city‚Äôs past is preserved. The blend of historical significance and contemporary design creates a captivating atmosphere that invites you to explore further. So, grab your camera and get ready to discover the architectural wonders that make Visakhapatnam a must-visit destination!
