data.title: The 37 best beaches in and around Visakhapatnam

placeMetadata.name: Yarada Beach

sources.snippet: To reach the beach , you have to cross the eastern ghats and the journey would take you along snaking mountainous road which would make you doubt for a moment if you are in South India or the Himalayas in the North. You can see the Visakhapatnam city slowly becoming smaller and smaller and then you can see the lovely city sprawling across the rocky eastern ghats and the glistening blue waters of the Bay of Bengal. When you reach the beach , be ready to skip a heart beat again as the blue sea , the white sands, coconut groves and the garland of rocks welcome you.
sources.shortName: Traveling To Visakhapatnam Here Are 6 Beaches That You Must Visit

sources.snippet: Vizag is dotted with many beaches along its coastline, with the most famous one being the Yarada Beach. One of the most stunning places to see in all of Visakhapatnam, Yarada beach is surrounded by majestic hills on three sides, and by the Bay of Bengal on the other side. One of the best things about Vizag‚Äôs beaches is that they are a lot cleaner and a lot less crowded than other famous beaches along the Indian coastline, and Yarada beach is no exception.
sources.shortName: Tourism | Visakhapatnam District, Government of Andhra Pradesh

sources.snippet: A heavenly layout of the mountain-beach duality makes for the perfect scenario to enjoy magical holiday moments. The Yarada beach is a popular beach in Vishakhapatnam as it is surrounded by the mammoth hills as well as the huge Bay of Bengal, adding to the grandeur of its beauty. The beach is also embraced by lush greenery and beautiful palm trees that add to the play of colours on the entire landscape, making it an ideal beach for nature lovers.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a beach where you won‚Äôt find sandals and garbage bags tucked under the sand instead of seashells, head to the Yarada beach right away. It‚Äôs the cleanest Visakhapatnam beach with gorgeous hills surrounding on three sides and the Bay of Bengal on the fourth. In short, this is one of those beaches that‚Äôll make you feel exactly like how a Julia Roberts film does ‚Äì warm, inspiring, and all things full of life.
sources.shortName: Beaches to Visit in Vizag

sources.snippet: Yarada  Beach is one of the secluded  beaches in Visakhapatnam that offers much-needed tranquility and relaxation no  matter  what  time  you arrive. This beach,  located  on the other  side  of  Dolphin Hill,  is  not  easily  accessible  to  city dwellers,  but  it  is worth  the trip. The  ride  to  this  magnificent  beach  via  Dolphin  Hill  provides  some  breathtaking  views  of  the  sea  as  well  as  the city.
sources.shortName: 13 Soul soothing beaches in and around Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Yarada Beach is an entrancing site which is surrounded by hills on three sides and the Bay of Bengal on the fourth, covered with lush greenery and soft golden sands all over. It is an ideal location especially for the nature lovers as one gets to view enchanting sunrises and sunsets on this coastline. The beach is situated at a distance of 15 km from Visakhapatnam and does not remain very crowded.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches to see in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Yarada Beach is one of the most calm beaches in Visakhapatnam, known for its golden sands and lush greenery. As one of the best beaches to visit in Visakhapatnam, it offers a perfect retreat for those seeking peace and natural beauty. Less crowded than other public beaches in Visakhapatnam, Yarada Beach provides a serene environment, making it a gem in Visakhapatnam beach tourism.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Beaches in Visakhapatnam: Best Travel Guide

sources.snippet: You can take a day tour of the city to explore the beaches namely; RK Beach, Rushikonda Beach, Bheemili Beach, Appikonda Beach and Yarada Beach are some of the great beaches in Vizag. Most of these beaches have various eateries where you can get the authentic taste of local street food. The Rushikonda beach is the most visited beach in Vizag.
sources.shortName: Places, Best Time & Tour Packages 2024

sources.snippet: Named after the village it is located in, yarada beach is one of the best tourist places in Vizag. Surrounded by mighty hills on three sides and the expansive Bay of Bengal on the fourth side, Yarada beach is an incredibly stunning location. The golden sands and pristine waters make the beach a masterpiece created by the nature.
sources.shortName: Top 4 Beaches in Vizag (2024)

sources.snippet: A little far from the city, Yarada Beach is located near Gangavaram Beach and Dolphin's Nose (a hill that resembles the nose of a dolphin). Full of rocky cliffs and greens, this beach instantly transports you to an exotic beach. If you have very little time on hand, we recommend skipping other beaches and checking this one out.
sources.shortName: Visit These Top Beaches In Vishakapatnam

sources.snippet: Bheemunipatnam Beach, surrounded by beautiful green coconut plantations, palm groves, lush greenery, and a refreshing climate, is a popular weekend getaway destination that offers visitors a comfortable and relaxed atmosphere as well as breathtaking sea views. reviews.reviewText:
Visited Yarada Beach with my friend Ayush during our Vizag trip, and it was an unforgettable experience! The drive to the beach was a bit risky ‚Äî winding roads and sharp turns made it quite the adventure ‚Äî but totally worth it for the breathtaking view that awaited us.
We spent a relaxing two hours there, soaking in the natural beauty and sipping on some of the biggest and freshest coconuts we‚Äôve ever had! ü••‚òÄÔ∏è The beach is clean, peaceful, and offers a perfect escape from the city buzz.
Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind with a scenic backdrop! Just be cautious on those roads. üòâ

Yarada is a beautiful long beach, with coconut grooves and dense hills on one side.
Good for long walks, quality time with family and kids or picnic.
Actual beach front is steep, not recommend for bathing due to safety reasons.
Not much of commercialization, no shacks, no restaurants.
It's painful to see such a beautiful beach surrounding littered with polythenes and bottles.

The drive to reach this beach is fairly decent, with accessible roads and manageable traffic. However, the beach itself is quite disappointing. Cleanliness is severely lacking, and the water quality is poor, making it an unappealing spot for visitors.

Swimming is not allowed, as there are multiple warning signs citing dangerous depths, which further limits the recreational appeal of this place. Overall, it's one of the worst beach experiences I've had.

I sincerely hope the local authorities take action to improve the condition of the beach‚Äîboth in terms of cleanliness and safety‚Äîso it can become a more enjoyable destination in the future.

This beach is a hidden gem ‚Äî little far from the city but peaceful and less crowded, perfect for a relaxing getaway. The sunset views are absolutely stunning, and the water is remarkably clear. While there aren‚Äôt any major restaurants nearby, you'll find plenty of street food options to satisfy your cravings. Another plus is the ample parking space, which makes visiting hassle-free.

The surrounding hills are covered with lush greenery, adding to the scenic beauty of the beach.Yarada Beach is less crowded compared to other commercial beaches, making it an ideal spot for relaxation and quality time with family and friends.The beach's untouched beauty and serene atmosphere make it an attractive destination for those seeking a peaceful getaway.
If someone prefers peace and privacy and doesn‚Äôt like crowded places, then this spot is really, really good ‚Äî perfect for a quiet escape.

Beautiful beach ‚õ±Ô∏è which is a hidden gem

reviews.reviewText:
In the month of March, I had the opportunity to visit Rushikonda Beach in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, with my close friend Ayush. It turned out to be one of the most enjoyable and refreshing experiences of our trip. Known for its natural beauty and clean shoreline, Rushikonda Beach is truly a gem on the east coast.

The beach was lively yet peaceful, with golden sands and clear blue waters creating a stunning view. The gentle waves and cool breeze made it a perfect spot to relax and unwind. We spent a good amount of time walking along the shore, chatting, and soaking in the serene atmosphere.

What made the experience even better was the scenic drive to the beach. Surrounded by lush greenery and coastal roads, the journey itself was quite beautiful. The beach is also a great place for water sports like jet skiing and surfing, which adds excitement for adventure lovers, though we mainly went there to enjoy the peaceful vibe.

Food stalls near the beach served tasty local snacks, allowing us to enjoy a light meal while enjoying the sea view. The beach was clean and well-maintained, which made our visit even more pleasant.

Overall, Rushikonda Beach is a must-visit destination in Vizag for anyone who loves nature, sea views, and a relaxed vibe. It was a memorable experience that I‚Äôd highly recommend to others. I would love to visit again someday.

This is the only beach in Vizag where one can do swimming and also do water sports such as jet ski, speed boat and many more. This is also one of the most popular beaches among tourists. The beach is very lively and there are some good photogenic spots as well.

This is one of the best beaches of Vizag. The    sea current is usually gentle here, with a constant watch from the security, warning tourists venturing little inside the sea. A lot of families with kids and friends in groups make the most of this lovely sea coast playing in the serene beaches, enjoying the water rides, taking lovely photos, riding horses, and kids collecting sea shells.
Note that Scuba diving is open only in winters between Sep through Jan. On the other days, one can enjoy speed boats and speed scooter rides.
Note:
This beach does not have a facility  to shower. The facility that AP tourism provides is mostly non- functional; most of the time, there would be no water. So please make your own arrangements. The support staff at this facility are extremely arrogant and rude. Avoid this place.
There would be numerous photographers reaching out to you for snaps. Be very careful dealing with them.
Also, please be aware that the speed boat driver would usually ask for additional money to take you a little more inside the sea - don't encourage this. This is another trick to fool tourists and make more money.

Marvelous beach . Suitable for various activities.
You can fully enjoy the sea here , coast guards are always alert, you can take your family and happily spend some times

"I'm absolutely blown away by Rushikonda Beach! As a city dweller, I was thrilled to discover this stunning beach so close to the city center. The best part? It's incredibly accessible via public transport, making it easy for anyone to visit.

But what truly sets Rushikonda Beach apart is its vibrant atmosphere and abundance of amenities. The beach is lined with an incredible variety of food and snack stalls, catering to every taste and craving. From spicy street food to refreshing coconut water, you'll find it all here!

The beach itself is pristine and well-maintained, with plenty of space to soak up the sun, take a dip, or simply relax with family and friends. The scenic views of the surrounding landscape are simply breathtaking, especially during sunrise and sunset.

I've visited many beaches in my life, but Rushikonda Beach stands out for its unique blend of natural beauty, convenience, and amenities. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this beach is an absolute must-visit. Five stars isn't enough ‚Äì I'd give it ten stars if I could!

*Pros:* Easily accessible, variety of food stalls, pristine beach, scenic views

*Cons:* None!

*Recommendation:* Visit Rushikonda Beach for a day of relaxation, fun, and sun. You won't regret it!"

The beach is also perfect for relaxation, with plenty of space to sunbathe, or simply enjoy the scenery.The beach offers a range of water sports, including jet skiing, windsurfing, scuba diving, snorkeling,horse riding, dune buggy rides, and other adventure activities.

reviews.reviewText: Beautiful beach with a small park up front and a few fast food stalls. Peaceful place and a good open road ride, free of city traffic towards the beach. Photographers at the beach are the most annoying things there. They won't leave you the whole time.

Unlike bustling city beaches, Bheemili offers a quiet and tranquil atmosphere, ideal for relaxation.¬†The beach boasts golden sands and calm waters, making it perfect for enjoying the sea.
There may be limited options for restaurants and hotels in the immediate area, so it's advisable to carry food and water.

Why Bheemli Beach is a Must-Visit:

1. Scenic Drive: The 25-30 km ride from Vishakhapatnam Beach Road to Bheemli is breathtaking, with lush greenery, towering trees, and majestic mountains on one side and the sea on the other.
2. Thrilling Ride: Riding a scooty adds to the thrill of the journey, making it an exhilarating experience.
3. Serene Beach: Bheemli Beach is a peaceful escape, with smaller stones and fewer crowds, making it perfect for relaxation.
4. Natural Beauty: The beach is surrounded by natural beauty, with the sea on one side and mountains on the other, creating a unique and picturesque landscape.
5. Peaceful Atmosphere: The beach is ideal for those seeking a tranquil getaway, away from the hustle and bustle of city life.

Overall, Bheemli Beach is a hidden gem near Vishakhapatnam, offering a unique blend of natural beauty, adventure, and relaxation.

"I'm absolutely thrilled to give Bheemili Beach a well-deserved 5-star review! This stunning beach has stolen my heart with its pristine beauty, picturesque surroundings, and warm village hospitality.

Firstly, the beach itself is incredibly clean and well-maintained. The sand is soft, the waters are calm, and the scenery is simply breathtaking. It's the perfect spot to relax, unwind, and soak up the sun.

But what truly sets Bheemili Beach apart is its stunning location within a beautiful village. The surrounding landscape is dotted with lush greenery, quaint cottages, and winding roads that seem to whisper stories of the past. It's a truly immersive experience that will leave you enchanted.

And just when I thought it couldn't get any better, I discovered the newly opened Coco Arena! This incredible spot is surrounded by majestic coco trees that provide the most wonderful shade during the scorching summer months. It's the perfect spot to escape the heat and enjoy the cool ocean breeze.

I've visited many beaches in my life, but Bheemili Beach stands out for its unique blend of natural beauty, village charm, and modern amenities. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this beach is an absolute must-visit. Five stars isn't enough ‚Äì I'd give it ten stars if I could!

*Pros:* Pristine beach, picturesque village surroundings, newly opened Coco Arena with coco trees providing shade

*Cons:* None!

*Recommendation:* Head to Bheemili Beach for a day of relaxation, exploration, and fun in the sun. Don't forget to visit the Coco Arena for a truly unforgettable experience!"

reviews.reviewText:
"I'm absolutely delighted to give RK Beach a well-deserved 5-star review! This stunning beach has become my go-to spot for relaxation and fun in the sun.

Firstly, the beach's proximity to public transport makes it incredibly easy to get to, even for those without their own vehicles. The convenience factor is a huge plus in my book!

Once you arrive, you'll be spoiled for choice with the vast array of snacks available. From crispy street food to refreshing coconut water, and from spicy local delicacies to sweet treats, there's something for every taste and craving. I was impressed by the variety and quality of the snacks on offer!

The beach itself is beautifully maintained, with clean sand, calm waters, and picturesque views. It's the perfect spot to unwind, take a leisurely stroll, or simply enjoy quality time with family and friends.

I've visited RK Beach multiple times, and each time I'm impressed by its charm and character. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this beach is an absolute must-visit. Five stars isn't enough ‚Äì I'd give it ten stars if I could!

*Pros:* Easily accessible, variety of snacks, well-maintained beach, picturesque views

*Cons:* None!

*Recommendation:* Head to RK Beach for a day of relaxation, fun, and sun. You won't regret it!"
The beach is okay but there are better beaches in the city. The beach road is amazing though, and all the museums are located around here.

I recently visited RK Beach in Vizag with my family, and it was truly an amazing experience! We went there around 9 PM and ended up staying until 1:30 in the morning ‚Äî that‚Äôs how beautiful and peaceful the place was. Time just flew by without us even realizing it.

The night view of the beach was simply fantastic. The sound of the sea waves, the cool breeze, and the reflection of the moon on the water created a magical atmosphere. It was a perfect night for relaxation and quality family time. There were many other families there too, enjoying the calm and safe environment.

My kids had a great time playing on the sand and watching the waves. The beach was lively but not too crowded, which made it even more enjoyable. One of the best things was that even at night, there were small stalls available for snacks, tea, and coffee ‚Äî perfect for keeping warm and refreshed.

Overall, it was a memorable night by the sea. RK Beach is definitely a must-visit spot in Vizag, especially if you want to spend peaceful, happy moments with your loved ones. We‚Äôre already planning to come back again soon!

Highlight of Vizag. The beautiful beach, well maintained and happening.  Visitors can simply go to the beach, sit on the seats and enjoy the view. The port can also be seen on the right hand side. There are plenty hotels, restaurants, cafes and street food options. Perfect family weekend outing spot also. A must visit place.

Located just around 1-2 km from the Submarine museum the Ramakrishna Beach provides a beautiful view of the Bay of Bengal. The trees give it like you're actually in any tropical island kind of vibe. The beach side is well maintained with hygiene and has some sitting stuff. The place is also very photogenic where one can get a good picture with a dazzling sea view. I'd recommend this place for sure. üèñÔ∏è

RK Beach is truly one of the gems of Vizag! The gentle sound of waves, the soft golden sands, and the clean, well-maintained promenade make it the perfect place for a peaceful evening walk or a relaxing family outing. üåÖ
The sunrise here is absolutely breathtaking ‚Äì definitely worth waking up early for! There are plenty of local food stalls nearby where you can enjoy fresh snacks and chai while watching the ocean.
Loved the overall vibe ‚Äî calm, clean, and scenic. Whether you're a local or a tourist, RK Beach is a must-visit spot to unwind and soak in nature's beauty. üíôüìç Highly recommend visiting during early morning or sunset hours for the best experience.

Nice place to visit with family and friends
But I was searching for sea food there, I have seen mostly the chat, sweet corn and other stalls more, but any how many eateries nearby opposite the road but I was searching in beach itself

I visited RK Beach in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, in the month of March with my close friend Ayush, and it was a memorable experience overall. We reached the beach early in the morning to enjoy the peaceful atmosphere and cool breeze. The sound of the waves and the sunrise created a beautiful and calming start to our day.

However, one major downside was our experience with the local photographers on the beach. We were scammed by a few of them who overcharged us and delivered very poor-quality photos. Their behavior was rude and unprofessional. I strongly recommend that visitors avoid getting their pictures clicked by the beachside photographers, as most of them are not trustworthy and lack basic manners.

Aside from that, we had a great time. We walked along the beach, explored nearby streets, and took in the stunning coastal views. The area around the beach has a lively yet relaxed vibe. In the evening, we returned to the beach and sat by the shore, watching the waves and enjoying the cool breeze. The view during sunset was absolutely beautiful and added to the overall charm of the place.

Despite the issue with the photographers, our visit to RK Beach was fun and enjoyable. It‚Äôs a great spot for both early morning and evening visits. The natural beauty of the beach is worth experiencing. Just be a bit cautious with the photographers, and you‚Äôll have a great time.

Gangavaram Beach, nestled in the vibrant city of Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, India, offers a serene escape from the urban hustle. This picturesque beach, with its soft sands and cool breeze, is a haven for those seeking tranquility and natural beauty.

The beach is renowned for its secluded atmosphere, providing a perfect backdrop for relaxation and rejuvenation. Imagine yourself strolling along the shoreline, the gentle waves caressing your feet, while the sun sets in the distance, painting the sky with hues of orange and pink.

Gangavaram Beach is not just a visual delight; it also offers a range of activities to engage visitors. You can enjoy a picnic with your loved ones, bask in the sun's warmth, or try your hand at beach volleyball. For those seeking adventure, a trek to the nearby hillock offers panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.

The beach is surrounded by lush palm trees, adding to its charm and providing shade for those seeking respite from the sun. The serene environment and natural beauty of Gangavaram Beach make it a popular spot for film and television shoots.

While Gangavaram Beach is a must-visit destination in Visakhapatnam, it's essential to be mindful of the environment. The construction of the nearby Gangavaram Port has led to some concerns about pollution, which could potentially impact the beach's pristine beauty.

Overall, Gangavaram Beach is a delightful destination for those seeking a peaceful and rejuvenating getaway. Its natural beauty, coupled with a range of activities, makes it a must-visit spot in Visakhapatnam. However, it's crucial to be aware of the environmental concerns and contribute to preserving the beach's charm for future generations.

reviews.reviewText: Good location for family to spend time in the mornings and evenings. There are steps from the garden to the beach. Great view of the beach, mountains and the city. The abandoned ship is a good attraction.

BEAUTIFUL PLACE BUT WITH LOTS OF SCAMMERS.

This is a wonderful place to relax and enjoy the scenic beauty. However, the experience is often spoiled by scammers posing as photographers who deceive visitors and extract large sums of money. They usually operate in groups, surrounding their targets and even resorting to threats if their demands are not met.

At first, they persistently offer to take photos, claiming that each picture costs only ‚Çπ20. The seemingly reasonable price may make you agree, but this is where the trick begins. They proceed to take numerous photos without your consent and later display them at a rapid pace, allowing you to view each image only once. Once selected, you cannot go back and change your choices. Some photos may be barely visible, yet they are included in the count.

Unknowingly, you might believe you‚Äôve selected just 5-6 photos, but they claim you have chosen around 40-50. As a result, instead of paying ‚Çπ100-‚Çπ120 as planned, you are suddenly asked to pay ‚Çπ800-‚Çπ1000. If you refuse, they intimidate you and prevent you from leaving.

Visitors should stay cautious of these scammers, and the Visakhapatnam Police and Administration must take action to ensure public safety and protect the reputation of this beautiful destination.

placeMetadata.name: VMRDA INS Kursura Submarine Museum

sources.snippet: You‚Äôll find the Submarine Museum (or ‚ÄòSmritika‚Äô) standing prominently against the stunning backdrop of Ramakrishna beach. The first of its kind in all of South Asia, the INS (Indian Naval Service) Kurusura Submarine was a Soviet built-I-641 class Submarine, which after 31 years of service was decommissioned and converted into a fascinating museum for the public. There are six guides and a curator to inform and educate visitors about the complex workings of the submarine, and the simple experience of being inside a sub is a thrilling novelty.
sources.shortName: Top Things To See And Do In Visakhapatnam, India

sources.snippet: This prestigious museum is dedicated to cherish the victory of INS KURUSURA, an Indian submarine for its crucial role in Indo-Pakistan war. The submarine has been decommissioned in the year 2001 and placed on the RK beach as public museum. This 93-meter submarine museum provides us information about the functions and interiors of the underwater submarine.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Places To Visit in Visakhapatnam (Vizag)

sources.snippet: The decommissioned submarine, the INS Kursura, was transformed into a museum‚Äîone of its kind in the country. The submarine was commissioned into the Indian Navy in 1969 and served for over three decades before being decommissioned in 2001. You can take a tour of the museum and learn about the technology of submarines, as well as the life of submariners.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The VMRDA INS Kursura Submarine Museum, located on RK Beach in Visakhapatnam, is a popular tourist attraction. This museum features the INS Kurusura, a Russian-built submarine that was inducted into the Indian Navy in 1969 and decommissioned in 2001 after 31 years of service. It is the first submarine museum in Asia and the second in the world.
placeMetadata.address: P88J+V2W, RK Beach Rd, Kirlampudi Layout, Chinna Waltair, Pandurangapuram, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 530017, India

reviews.reviewText:
Must visit the spot. You can get a combo ticket which gives entry to the submarine, aircraft museum and sea harrier. They are all located in walkable distance near RK beach. Try to visit in the evening as it will be cool. There will be air conditioning throughout the tour, so no need to worry about ventilation.

There will be colourful lighting for submarine from the evening which will be a good view from opposite road.

There is no allocated car parking area around, but you can easily find bike parking on the pavement.

INS Kursura Submarine Museum ‚Äì A Fascinating Dive into Naval History

The INS Kursura Submarine Museum is an absolute must-visit if you're in Visakhapatnam. Stepping inside the actual decommissioned submarine gives a rare and thrilling glimpse into the life of naval officers underwater. It's not just a museum ‚Äì it feels like stepping into a preserved piece of living history.

The submarine itself is compact and impressive. As you move through the narrow corridors and peek into the control rooms, torpedo bays, and sleeping quarters, you can‚Äôt help but admire the bravery and discipline of the crew who once lived and worked here for months at a time.
The museum staff, many of whom are ex-navy personnel, do an excellent job explaining the submarine‚Äôs operations and sharing fascinating stories about life under the sea.

From a technical, historical, and emotional perspective, the INS Kursura offers a deeply enriching experience. It‚Äôs also beautifully maintained, right by the beach, making it a perfect blend of education and a day out by the sea.

Tip: Visit in the evening for a cooler experience and enjoy the illuminated view of the submarine at night!

The INS Kursura Submarine Museum is one of the most fascinating attractions in Vizag and a must-visit for history and defense enthusiasts. Housed inside a real decommissioned submarine, the museum gives visitors a rare opportunity to step into the life of naval officers and sailors who once served at sea.

Walking through the narrow passages, control rooms, and crew quarters offers a deep appreciation of the discipline, courage, and challenges faced by submariners. The displays are informative and well-curated, showcasing the submarine‚Äôs operations, equipment, and legacy.

The highlight is the chance to experience firsthand the compact living and working conditions inside a submarine, which leaves you with immense respect for the Indian Navy. Its location along RK Beach adds to the appeal, making it easy to combine with a beachside stroll.

Overall, the INS Kursura Submarine Museum is an educational, unique, and memorable experience that offers both adults and children a glimpse into India‚Äôs rich naval history

It is a must visit place in vizag. The experience is amazing. The view is breathtaking. The timings are restricted from 3PM - 5PM only, so plan accordingly.

It is located towards the south of vizag, roughly 25km from RK beach. The way goes through industrial areas, military areas and a steep ghat road. The ghat road journey can be a little tough with sharp turns, speed breakers, steep road and bumpy patches.

Once you reach the entrance, there is a good parking area and you can buy the entry ticket. From there you need to walk around 200-300m to the main lighthouse. From there you need to climb around 70 normal steps and 10-12 steps in a ladder to reach the top.

The view is just breathtaking and very wholesome. The wind will be strong, so take care of your belongings. And walk slowly as there is less area to roam on the top. Cellphone signals will be weak here.

The Dolphin‚Äôs Nose Lighthouse is one of Vizag‚Äôs hidden gems and absolutely worth a visit. Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse: A Vizag Gem with Room for Improvement (and a Few Quirks)

Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse offers an undeniably nice atmosphere with amazing views that are well worth the visit. Perched atop the iconic Dolphin's Nose hill, the panoramic vistas of the Bay of Bengal, the sprawling Vizag coastline, and the surrounding lush greenery are simply breathtaking. It's a fantastic spot to enjoy the sea breeze, capture stunning photographs, and simply soak in the natural beauty of the region.
However, the experience does come with a few notable caveats. During my visit, the entry was open but the lighthouse itself was not accessible, and there was no explanation provided. This was quite disappointing, as the opportunity to explore the lighthouse interior and potentially ascend for an even higher vantage point is a significant draw. Clear signage or a staff member on hand to explain the closure would greatly enhance the visitor experience.
There is a nominal entry fee of ‚Çπ10 per person, which is quite reasonable for the views on offer. A practical point to note for future visitors is that only cash is accepted for entry fees. In an increasingly digital world, the lack of UPI or other e-commerce payment provisions feels outdated and inconvenient. Having to scramble for cash can detract from the initial excitement of arrival.
Additionally, should the lighthouse be open during your visit, be prepared to remove your shoes for entry. While this isn't a major inconvenience, it's good to be aware of beforehand, especially if you're wearing footwear that's difficult to slip on and off.
Despite these minor frustrations and quirks, the sheer beauty of the location makes Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse a recommended stop in Vizag. If the operational aspects, particularly the consistent accessibility of the lighthouse and payment options, could be improved, it would undoubtedly elevate this already picturesque destination to a truly top-tier attraction.
Really amazing place to view all of vizag. Entry fee ‚Çπ10. Not too much to see here so doesn‚Äôt take much time.

reviews.reviewText:
Indira Gandhi Zoological Park in Visakhapatnam is a must-visit destination for wildlife enthusiasts and families. Spread across 625 acres, it's one of the largest zoos in India, housing around 843 animals from 123 species.

- *Natural Setting*: The zoo is nestled in the Eastern Ghats, providing a natural habitat for the animals.
- *Variety of Animals*: Visitors can spot tigers, lions, elephants, giraffes, and various bird species.
- *Conservation Efforts*: The zoo is involved in breeding programs for endangered species like the Asiatic wild dog.
- *Educational Programs*: The zoo offers educational activities and workshops for children and adults.
- *Food Options*: Some visitors have reported limited food options within the zoo.
- *Crowd Management*: The zoo can get crowded, especially on weekends and
- *Plan Ahead*: Check the zoo's timings and entry fees before visiting.
- *Wear Comfortable Shoes*: The zoo is spread over a large area, so wear comfortable shoes for walking.
- *Bring Water and Snacks*: While there are food options available, it's a good idea to bring

The zoo was completely clean and well maintained. I saw animals like Tiger, Lion, jackals, crocodiles, cheetah, deer, elephants, various types of birds and many more. I went in a cool weather which made the place look more attractive. Animals are being taken care properly by the authorities. Inside there are places to have ice cream, tea or coffee. The place is worth visiting for wildlife lovers.

Vizag Zoo Park
We recently visited Vizag Zoo Park with our family, and it was a wonderful experience! We saw a wide variety of animals including tigers, white tigers, elephants, giraffes, crocodiles, snakes, lions, deer, and even an anaconda. The kids were especially excited to see the different species of birds, peacocks, and tortoises.

We chose to explore the entire zoo on foot, which allowed us to enjoy the natural beauty and greenery all around. It was a refreshing and peaceful walk, and a great way to connect with nature while learning about wildlife.

We also visited the butterfly zone, which looked nice, but unfortunately there were no butterflies at the time. That was a bit disappointing, but overall it didn‚Äôt take away from the experience.

The zoo is well-maintained and perfect for a family outing. My kids really enjoyed everything, and we had a great time together. Highly recommended for a fun and educational day out in nature

I visited this zoo around 10 years ago, and recently revisited it ‚Äî I was genuinely amazed by how much it's changed! The transformation is unbelievable. The zoo is now home to a wide variety of animals, and the overall experience has been significantly upgraded.

The infrastructure is impressive, with beautifully maintained greenery throughout. There are plenty of benches and shaded areas under large trees, making it a very comfortable place to rest as you explore.

Despite the hot weather outside, the zoo felt pleasantly cool thanks to the abundance of trees and plants, which really enhance the environment and provide a natural cooling effect.

The zoo also has free drinking water stations at multiple spots, which is a thoughtful and much-needed facility, especially during warmer months.

There‚Äôs a canteen inside the zoo too. I tried the chicken biryani, which was surprisingly tasty. They also serve meals, though I found those to be just average in taste.

For convenience, the zoo offers traveller vehicles and electric cycles, which are great for covering the large area without getting too tired.

Overall, it‚Äôs a fantastic place to hang out with family or friends. Whether you're there for the animals, the peaceful greenery, or just a relaxing day out, this zoo has truly become a great destination. Highly recommended!

The best visit time is around 11 to 11:30 AM as it is the feeding time for the animals.

Overall, a great outing spot with lots to see and learn. With a few small improvements, it can become one of the best zoological parks in the region!

The Vizag Zoo is a well-planned and thoughtfully designed zoo that offers visitors an enjoyable experience amidst nature. Spread out across a large area, it features a wide variety of animal exhibits that are both educational and engaging. The enclosures are generally spacious, allowing the animals to move freely and providing visitors with a closer-to-natural experience.

One of the main highlights of the zoo is undoubtedly the White Bengal Tigers. These majestic animals are a major attraction, and watching them up close is a memorable experience.

Visitors can choose between driving through the zoo in their own car or opting for a personal buggy ride, which makes it convenient for families and those who prefer a guided, comfortable tour. To fully explore the zoo and its exhibits, it usually takes around 2‚Äì3 hours.

At the same time, certain sections of the zoo are undergoing upgrading and renovation works, which is a positive sign of continuous improvement. Once completed, these will further enhance the visitor experience and the welfare of the animals.

Overall, Vizag Zoo strikes a fine balance between recreation and conservation, making it a great place for families, animal lovers, and tourists alike.

Tenneti Park: A Word of Caution

Teneti Park is a scenic spot, especially with the decommissioned ship anchored along the shore ‚Äî a picturesque sight that draws many visitors. However, beware of scammers posing as photographers near the ship.

These individuals will offer to take your photo for a small fee (‚Çπ20 per photo), but it‚Äôs a trap. Even if you clearly say you want only 5 pictures, they will click hundreds, then claim they can‚Äôt delete any of the selected ones. You‚Äôll be forced to pay for low-quality, poorly composed images taken on substandard cameras by people with zero photography skills.

They usually wait in a shed near the old ship, targeting unsuspecting tourists.

Avoid them at all costs. Don‚Äôt fall for the scam!!!

A must-visit tourist attraction on the Vizag tour, the Victory at Sea War Memorial generates a sense of patriotism as soon as you enter the place. The Victory at Sea Memorial in Vizag is a compact, poignant, and thoughtfully located tribute to the Indian Navy and the sacrifices of naval personnel during the 1971 Indo-Pak War. It‚Äôs not a full, detailed museum ‚Äî but as an outdoor memorial, it does a good job of combining solemn remembrance with scenic waterfront ambiance, making it well-suited for short visits, personal reflection, or as part of a broader beach road walk.

If you‚Äôre traveling in Visakhapatnam, especially along Beach Road, the Victory at Sea Memorial is a worthy stop: not just for its historical resonance, but also for the peaceful, contemplative space it provides next to the sea. It pairs particularly well with visits to the Ramakrishna Beach and the INS Kurusura Submarine Museum, turning the walk into both a tour and a moment of remembering the naval heritage of the city.

**TU 142 Aircraft Museum ‚Äì Family Visit ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞**

During our recent trip to Visakhapatnam, we visited the TU 142 Aircraft Museum located near RK Beach, close to the HPCL Colony. It was an exciting and educational experience for our whole family. The museum is centered around the decommissioned TU 142M aircraft, a long-range maritime patrol and anti-submarine warfare aircraft used by the Indian Navy.

The aircraft, now on display, has been beautifully preserved. We were amazed by its massive size and advanced features for its time. Inside the museum, there are several informative exhibits about the aircraft‚Äôs history, its role in Indian defense, and the technology used. The children especially enjoyed the interactive screens and videos that explained how the aircraft operated.

The museum is well-maintained, with clean surroundings and helpful staff. We also appreciated the neatly arranged photo gallery and the short documentary that gave us more insights into naval aviation.

Overall, it was a fun and educational outing for all of us. The visit gave us a sense of pride in our nation‚Äôs defense achievements. We highly recommend the TU 142 Museum to families visiting Vizag ‚Äì it's a great combination of learning and enjoyment.üëåüëçü§ùü§ùü§ùü•∞

Recently visited the TU 142 Aircraft Museum and had a great experience. It's a well-maintained museum where you can actually walk through a real Navy aircraft and see the cockpit, crew area, and equipment used during its service. It's really informative and perfect for anyone interested in aviation or defense history. Located right on Beach Road, it's definitely worth a visit.

ENTRY TIMINGS::
Tuesday to Sunday: 11:00 AM ‚Äì 8:30 PM
Monday: Closed

Entry Fee:
‚Çπ 70 per person

**Great Aviation Museum by the Beach**
Amazing experience inside the TU‚Äë142 aircraft! The displays are well-organized, informative, and kid-friendly. Perfect for aviation lovers and right across from the submarine museum. Worth the visit!

Great museum, the entrance with the long curved room with different sections is really interesting, it has all sorts of things like memorials for pilots, a lifeboat, an engine and more cool things. The tu142 itself is also preserved very well, I just wish the flight deck was not chained off.

In March, I had the pleasure of visiting the 142 Aircraft Museum in Visakhapatnam with a friend, and it turned out to be one of the most memorable experiences of our trip. Located right along the beautiful RK Beach and near the iconic INS Kurusura Submarine Museum, the aircraft museum offers a fascinating glimpse into Indian Naval aviation history.

The highlight of the museum is the HAL Tupolev Tu-142M aircraft, which served the Indian Navy for nearly three decades. Standing tall and majestic, the aircraft‚Äôs sheer size is impressive and commands attention. Inside the museum, we got to explore the aircraft's interior, including its cockpit, radar systems, and sonar room, all of which are preserved to reflect its operational condition. The exhibits and displays were informative and well-organized, with plenty of background on the aircraft‚Äôs missions, technology, and history.

What made the visit even more exciting was the proximity to the submarine museum, offering a rare chance to explore both naval air and underwater defense technology at one location. The setting by the beach added to the charm, making it perfect for a relaxed yet educational outing.

The staff was helpful, and the entry process was smooth. I‚Äôd highly recommend the 142 Aircraft Museum to anyone visiting Vizag‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre an aviation enthusiast, history buff, or just looking for a unique experience by the sea. It‚Äôs a tribute to India‚Äôs naval legacy and a proud piece of maritime history.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Visakhapatnam, often referred to as Vizag, is a coastal gem nestled along the eastern shores of India. With its stunning beaches, each offering a unique charm, this vibrant city is a paradise for sun-seekers and adventure enthusiasts alike. From the lively Ramakrishna Beach, where the waves crash against the rocky formations, to the serene Yarada Beach, known for its crystal-clear waters and breathtaking cliffs, there's a perfect spot for everyone to unwind and soak in the natural beauty. Whether you're looking to ride the waves, enjoy a peaceful sunset, or explore hidden treasures, Vizag's coastline has it all.

As you stroll along the sandy shores, you'll discover a delightful mix of popular destinations and lesser-known hideaways. Bheemili Beach invites you to dive into its rich history while indulging in water sports, while the tranquil Gangavaram Beach offers a peaceful retreat surrounded by palm trees. For those seeking a bit of adventure, Rushikonda Beach is a hotspot for water sports and delicious local snacks. With so many options to choose from, the Wanderlog team is excited to share our passion for exploring these beautiful beaches. So pack your bags and get ready to explore the stunning coastline of Visakhapatnam!
